title.rendered: Training for Employees Involved in University of La Verne’s Title IX Formal Grievance and Informal Resolution Processes

content.rendered:
The University of La Verne ensures that all employees, including faculty, staff, and external contracted professional, who perform duties pursuant to the University’s Title IX Formal Grievance and Informal Resolution processes receive training that complies with the requirements of the Title IX of the Education Amendments of 1972 and the 34 CFR Part 106.45(b)(10).

Materials used to train employees and external contracted professionals, including materials used for trainings conducted prior to August 14, 2020, may be accessed below.

ATIXA Title IX Fundamentals for Higher Education

ATIXA Coordinator One Certification Course

ATIXA Coordinator Two Certification Course: Pressures, Politics, Sanctions, Minors & MOUs

ATIXA Investigator Level One Certification Course

ATIXA Investigator Level Three Certification Course

ATIXA Investigative Report Writing Certification Course

ATIXA Title IX Hearing Officer and Decision-Maker Certification Course

ATIXA Informal Resolution Foundations Certification Course

Grand River Solutions Conducting Fair and Thorough Trauma-Informed Investigations

Grand River Solutions Report Writing Workshop–Day 1

Grand River Solutions Report Writing Workshop–Day 2

Jim Hopper Sexual Assault and the Brain

Jim Hopper Neurobiology of Sexual Assault: Experience, Thinking, and Memory

Jim Hopper and EVAWI Important Things to Get Right About the “Neurobiology of Trauma”–Part 1: Benefits of Understanding the Science

Jim Hopper and EVAWI Important Things to Get Right About the “Neurobiology of Trauma”–Part 2: Victim Responses During Sexual Assault

Jim Hopper and EVAWI Important Things to Get Right About the “Neurobiology of Trauma”–Part 3: Memory Processes

NACUA Title IX Coordinator Training Online Course: Fundamentals of the August 2020 Regulatory Requirements–Module 1: Jurisdiction and Other Threshold Topics

NACUA Title IX Coordinator Training Online Course: Fundamentals of the August 2020 Regulatory Requirements–Module 2: Formal Complaints, Investigations and Grievance Procedures

NACUA Title IX Coordinator Training Online Course: Fundamentals of the August 2020 Regulatory Requirements–Module 3: Policy and Training Obligations

NACUA Title IX Coordinator Training Online Course Class One: Definitions, Jurisdiction, and Preliminary Matters

NACUA Title IX Coordinator Training Online Course Class Two: Conducting a Title IX Investigation

NACUA Title IX Coordinator Training Online Course Class Three: The Grievance Process–Hearings and Appeals

NACUA Title IX Coordinator Training Online Course Class Four: Anatomy of an OCR Investigation

NACUA Title IX Coordinator Training Online Course Class Five: Title IX Training and Policies

NACUA Title IX Coordinator Training Online Course Class Six: Athletics Equity and Applying the New Regulations

NASPA Facilitating Fair and Effective Informal Resolution Processes Under Title IX

Parker Poe Attorneys and Counselors at Law PVB and Title IX Policy Issues in Higher Education

Train HR Learning How to Conduct an Internal Harassment and Bullying Investigation to Determine Facts and Minimize Liability

Train HR Learning How to Conduct an Internal Harassment and Bullying Investigation to Determine Facts and Minimize Liability

Womble Bond Dickinson Title IX/VAWA Sexual Harassment and Sexual Misconduct Training Series: Training for Investigators

Virginia Department of Criminal Justice Services The Four Corners of Title IX Regulatory Compliance
